channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Air Canada and Striking Flight Attendants’ Union Reach Tentative Deal
item.description: Thousands of flight attendants must still approve the agreement. The walkout, which began Saturday, has disrupted half a million travelers’ plans, the...

item.title: The ‘Bro IPO’ summer: Women are missing from boards and C-Suites in the current surge of public offerings
item.description: An analysis of IPO-related filings from the first two weeks of August show an alarming lack of gender diversity.

item.title: In Pursuing Trump Rival, Weaponization Czar Sidesteps Justice Dept. Norms
item.description: Edward R. Martin Jr.’s conduct is part of a pattern in which top administration officials try to use the vast powers of the government to cast the spe...

item.title: A Brief Note on the Difference Between Negotiation and Extortion
item.description: And while we’re at it, let’s think about the phrase “land swap.”

item.title: Markets are usually bubbly in Jackson Hole week. This year that might not happen
item.description: Powell’s Jackson Hole speech looms as markets temper Fed rate-cut bets, with hot PPI data, labor market weakness, and tariff risks clouding outlook.

item.title: Tether hires Trump’s top crypto official Bo Hines to help lead U.S. stablecoin expansion
item.description: Hines left his post in the White House earlier in August.

item.title: The Politics of Crime Are Perilous for Left and Right Alike
item.description: President Trump has latched on to concerns about crime, as liberals point to its decline. The politics often flip when it comes to mass shootings.

item.title: The Race to Rescue PBS and NPR Stations
item.description: The Knight Foundation and other top organizations are aiming to provide $50 million to stabilize the stations most at risk from the recent federal gov...

item.title: Originated in China, the “996” schedule of working 9am-9pm, 6 days a week comes to Silicon Valley
item.description: Some startups have embraced the hyper intense work style—but it may not last.

item.title: How Chili’s and Cheesecake Factory are defying consumer gloom and beating McDonald’s and Chipotle at their own game
item.description: Chili’s reported a 24% jump in same-store sales in its most recent earnings report.

item.title: What to Know About the Protests Outside U.K. Hotels Housing Asylum Seekers
item.description: A judge is set to decide if a hotel in Epping, England, can be barred from being used to accommodate asylum seekers, highlighting what has become a co...

item.title: Young People of Color Flocked to This Show. It Made Them Feel Seen.
item.description: The exhibition “Beloved Suburbs” drew more than 150,000 visitors to France’s Museum of the History of Immigration. “We really recognize ourselves in t...

item.title: Securing Postwar Ukraine, Even With Trump’s Pledge to Help, Is Complex
item.description: Russia seems unlikely to agree to Western troops in Ukraine as part of any deal to end the war.

item.title: White House Meeting Ends With Few Signs of Progress on Ukraine
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine pressed for security guarantees in a cordial meeting with President Trump and European leaders.
